sen.j: 一揆（いっき）とは、日本において何らかの理由により心を共にした共同体が心と行動を一つにして目的を達成しようとすること。
sen.e: Ikki refers to an attempt made by a community to achieve an object with its members put their minds and actions together in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The term "ikki" refers to an attempt made by a community in Japan to achieve an objective when its members put their minds and actions together.
The term "ikki" refers to an attempt made by a community in Japan to achieve an objective when members of the community that share the same sentiment work closely together for a certain reason.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。I can't think of any way of expressing the "心を一つにして" part of "心と行動を一つにして" without it sounding like something from a science fiction film or about a cult. I think this may be just a cultural thing and "work closely together" is the closest natural sounding expression I can come up with.

sen.j: またはそのために盟約、契約を結んで、政治的共同体を結成した集団及び、これを基盤とした既成の支配体制に対する武力行使を含む抵抗運動。
sen.e: Ikki also refers to a group of the persons forming a political community for the above attempt and a resistance (which may include the use of armed force) made by the group against the established government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: "Ikki" also refers to a group of persons forming a political community for the above attempt, as well as a resistance (which may include the use of armed force) made by the group against the established government.

"Ikki" can also refer to a group of people that form a political community by entering into an alliance or a contract to achieve an objective and to a resistance movement (which may employ armed force) formed by a group in opposition to the established government.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。わかりやすい訳に変更しました。

sen.j: ドイツ語のPutschの訳語としても使われる（ミュンヘン一揆など）。
sen.e: Ikki is also used as a Japanese equivalent to a German word Putsch (for example, Munchen Putsch).
Ikki is also used as a Japanese equivalent to the German word Putsch (for example, Munchen Putsch).
Ikki is also used as a Japanese equivalent to the German word Putsch (for example, Munchen Putsch).

sen.j: 『孟子』に由来する言葉である。
sen.e: The word is derived from Mencius.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The word is derived from Mencius.
The word is derived from Mencius.

sen.j: 江戸時代になると幕府に公認された既存の秩序以外の形で、こうした一揆の盟約による政治的共同体を結成すること自体が禁じられるようになる。
sen.e: In the Edo period, it is forbidden to form a political community by making a league of ikki in the forms other than those according to the existing order.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Edo period it was forbidden to form a political community by making a league of ikki in any form other than those according to the existing order.

During the Edo period, people were forbidden to form a political community by concluding an ikki in any form other than that which accorded with the existing order that was officially recognized by the shogunate government.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。また「一揆の盟約」を変更し、多少わかりやすく変更しました。

sen.j: 従って、近現代の日本では一揆自体があたかも反乱、暴動を意味する語であるかのように誤解されるようになった。
sen.e: That is why ikki began to be mistook for a word meaning a revolt or a riot in the modern Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: That is why, in modern Japan, ikki was eventually mistaken for a word meaning a revolt or a riot.
That is why, in modern Japan, ikki was eventually mistaken for a word meaning a revolt or a riot.

sen.j: 確かに一揆が反乱的、暴動的武力行使に踏み切ることもある。
sen.e: It is true that ikki sometimes embarked on a revolt or a riot using the armed forces, but the use of armed forces itself is not ikki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is true that ikki sometimes embarked on a revolt or a riot using armed forces, but the use of armed forces doesn't necessarily constitute ikki.
It is true that ikki sometimes embarked on a revolt or a riot using armed forces, but the use of armed forces doesn't necessarily constitute ikki.

sen.j: しかし、こうした武力行使が一揆なのではなく、これを行使する「盟約に基づく政治的共同体」そのものが一揆なのである。
sen.e: A "political community based on a league" that uses the armed forces is ikki..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A "political community based on a league" that uses the armed forces constitutes ikki.
A "political community based on a league" that uses the armed forces constitutes ikki.

sen.j: こういった誤解のため、日本の一揆が英訳されて海外に紹介されるに際しても、 riot, revolt といった暴動や反乱を意味する語として訳されるのが一般化してしまった。
sen.e: The Japanese ikki has been translated into English and introduced to the world with the above-mentioned mistake.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Japanese "ikki" has been translated into English and introduced to the world with the above-mentioned mistaken connotation.

Because of the above-mentioned misinterpretation, the Japanese word "ikki" has generally been introduced to the world through its English translation as "riot" or "revolt," words suggesting violent behavior in a public place or an illegal, sometimes violent attempt to change the political system.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。内容もわかりやすく修正しています。

sen.j: 近世の「百姓一揆」も peasant uprising と英訳されて紹介されている。
sen.e: Besides, the "hyakusho ikki" in the early-modern period has been translated into English as peasant uprising and introduced.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, the "hyakusho ikki" in the early-modern period has been translated and introduced into English as peasant uprising.
Moreover, the "hyakusho ikki" in the early-modern period has been translated and introduced into English as peasant uprising.

sen.j: 現実には peasant の意味する零細な小作人だけによるものではない。
sen.e: Actually, however, "hyakusho ikki" was started not only by the small-scale tenant farmers who are expressed by the word peasant.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, "hyakusho ikki" was started not only by the small-scale tenant farmers, as represented by the word "peasant."
However, "hyakusho ikki" was started not only by the small-scale tenant farmers, as represented by the word "peasant."

sen.j: むしろ村落の指導的な立場に立つ裕福な本百姓らによって指導されていた。
sen.e: In fact, "hyakusho ikki" was led by rich free-hold farmers who would play a leading role in the village.
In fact, "hyakusho ikki" was led by affluent free-hold farmers who had leading roles in their villages.
In fact, "hyakusho ikki" was led by affluent free-hold farmers who had leading roles in their villages.

sen.j: 彼らはむしろ英語で農場経営者を指す語である farmer と訳すのがふさわしい。
sen.e: A proper English translation of the free-hold farmer is farmer which means the person who manages a farm.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A proper English translation of the free-hold farmer is farmer, which means the person who manages a farm.
A proper English translation of the free-hold farmer is farmer, which means the person who manages a farm.

sen.j: この事を考慮すると、これも歴史的事実に即した英訳とは言えない。
sen.e: Taking account that the proper English translation is farmer, translating "hyakusho ikki" as peasant uprising is not grounded in the historical facts either.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Considering that the proper English translation is "farmer," translating "hyakusho ikki" as "peasant uprising" is not grounded in historical fact.
Considering that the proper English translation is "farmer," translating "hyakusho ikki" as "peasant uprising" is not grounded in historical fact.

sen.j: 同様に、例えばミュンヘン一揆のように世界史における庶民や民衆運動による反乱、暴動も日本語訳されるときに一揆の語を当てることが慣用化している面がある。
sen.e: Conversely, a riot and a revolt caused by commoners and a popular movement in the world history, for example the Munchen Putsch, have been commonly translated into Japanese by using the word ikki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Conversely, a riot and a revolt caused by commoners and a popular movement in world history, such as the Munchen Putsch, have been commonly translated into Japanese with the use of the word "ikki."
Conversely, a riot and a revolt caused by commoners and a popular movement in world history, such as the Munchen Putsch, have been commonly translated into Japanese with the use of the word "ikki."

sen.j: これも中世の日本の一揆とは似て非なるものと言わざるを得ない。
sen.e: Those uprisings, however, let it be said, may appear similar but in fact quite different from ikki which occurred in Japan in the middle ages.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it should be noted that those uprisings may appear similar but are in fact quite different from the ikki that occurred in Japan during the middle ages.
However, it should be noted that those uprisings may appear similar but are in fact quite different from the ikki that occurred in Japan during the middle ages.

sen.j: 室町時代・戦国時代 (日本)を中心とした中世後期の日本社会を考える。
sen.e: Consider the Japanese society in the later middle ages around the Muromachi period and the Sengoku period (period of Japanese warring states).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Consider the Japanese society of the later middle ages around the Muromachi and Sengoku periods (the Warring States period).
Consider the Japanese society of the later middle ages around the Muromachi and Sengoku periods (the Warring States period).

sen.j: 下は庶民から上は大名クラスの領主達に至るまで、ほとんど全ての階層が、自ら同等な階層の者と考える者同士で一揆契約を結んだ。
sen.e: In that society, people in almost all levels from the commoners to the feudal lord in the class of daimyo (territorial lord) signed a contract of ikki with the others whom they considered to be in the same level.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In that society, people of nearly every level, from the commoners to the feudal lords in the daimyo (territorial lord) class signed contracts of ikki with others whom they considered to be of the same level.

In that society, people of nearly every level, from the commoners to the feudal lords in the daimyo (territorial lord) class signed contracts of ikki with others whom they considered to be of the same level.

sen.j: そうすることで、彼らは自らの権利行使の基礎を確保した。
sen.e: With that contract, the people secured the bases of execution of right.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With that contract, the people secured the basis for the execution of rights.
With that contract, the people secured the basis for the execution of rights.

sen.j: 正に一揆こそが社会秩序であったと言っても過言ではない。
sen.e: Therefore, it is not an exaggeration to say that ikki was actually the social order.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it is not an exaggeration to say that ikki was actually the social order.
Therefore, it is not an exaggeration to say that ikki was actually the social order.

sen.j: 戦国大名の領国組織も、正に一揆の盟約の積み重ねによって経営されていたのである。
sen.e: Daimyo in the Sengoku period operated its feudal domain system exactly by accumulating the leagues of ikki.
The daimyo of the Sengoku period would operate its feudal domain system precisely by accumulating the leagues of ikki.
The daimyo of the Sengoku period would operate its feudal domain system precisely by accumulating the leagues of ikki.

sen.j: 例えば戦国大名毛利氏の領国組織は、傘連判状による安芸国国人の一揆以外の何者でもなかった。
sen.e: For example, the feudal domain system of the Mori clan, a daimyo in the Sengoku period, was nothing but ikki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For example, the feudal domain system of the Mori clan, a daimyo of the Sengoku period, was nothing other than ikki.

For example, the feudal domain system employed by the Mori clan daimyo of the Sengoku period was nothing more than an ikki formed by the Kokujin (local samurai) in Aki Province under a karakasa renpanjo (a covenant entered into by both parties affixing their seals in a circle as a sign of their equality).
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。内容もわかりやすく修正しています。

sen.j: そのため、一揆が原因になることもあるが、政権の転覆を図る反乱、暴動、クーデターなどとは本来ははっきりと区別されるべき語である。
sen.e: Therefore, although ikki sometimes caused revolt, riot, and coup d'état each of which occurred in an attempt to overturn the regime, it should essentially be clearly distinguished from those words (revolt, riot, coup de'etat).

Therefore, although ikki sometimes caused revolts, riots and coup d'état, all of which occurred through efforts to overturn the regime, the word "ikki" should essentially be distinguished from those words (revolt, riot, coup d'état).

Therefore, although ikki sometimes caused revolts, riots and coup d'état, all of which occurred through efforts to overturn the regime, the word "ikki" should essentially be distinguished from those words (revolt, riot, coup d'état).

sen.j: このように、実際に一揆の盟約によって秩序が達成されていた中世後期があった。
sen.e: As such, in the later middle ages, the social order was actually secured based on the league of ikki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As such, in the later middle ages the social order was actually secured based on the league of ikki.
As such, in the later middle ages the social order was actually secured based on the league of ikki.

sen.j: 表向きは一揆が禁止されていた中で実際には百姓身分の権利行使運動として恒例化していた江戸時代のいわゆる百姓一揆の時期を経た。
sen.e: In the Edo period, ikki was ostensibly prohibited, but actually, there was a so-called hyakusho ikki (peasant uprising) phase.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Edo period ikki was ostensibly prohibited, but actually there was a so-called hyakusho ikki (peasant uprising) phase.

Although ikki was ostensibly prohibited during the Edo period, there was actually a period of time during which the so-called hyakusho ikki (peasant uprisings) regularly broke out as the peasantry sought to exercise their rights.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。内容もわかりやすく修正しています。

sen.j: こういった時期を経ることで、現代では一揆の本来の意味は忘れられ、理解されがたくなってしまっている。
sen.e: In the modern age, after that phase, the original meaning of ikki has been forgotten and become hard to be understood.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Today the original meaning of ikki has been forgotten and become difficult to understand.
As a result of such events, the original meaning of ikki has been forgotten today and become difficult to understand.
sen.cmt: 内容をわかりやすく修正しています。

sen.j: そのため、戦国大名毛利氏を成立させた毛利元就の生涯を描いた日本放送協会大河ドラマ『毛利元就 (NHK大河ドラマ)』において、元就が安芸国人の国人一揆を結ぶ場面で一揆の語の使用が避けられて、「国人領主連合」なる一種の現代語訳が用いられた例もある。
sen.e: A good example of that can be seen in the Japan Broadcasting Corporation Historical drama MORI MOTONARI (NHK Historical drama).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A good example of this can be seen in the Japan Broadcasting Corporation's historical drama, "MORI MOTONARI."

A good example of this can be seen in the Japan Broadcasting Corporation's historical drama "MORI MOTONARI," which depicts the life of the founder of the Mori clan, a daimyo who lived during the Sengoku period; in one episode, when the founder enters into a kokujin ikki with the kokujin of Aki Province, NHK substituted a more modern Japanese expression ("kokujin ryoshu rengo," meaning "local samurai-daimyo association") association") for the word "ikki".
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。内容もわかりやすく修正しています。

sen.j: また、中世後期の一揆の盟約による政治的共同体が武装していた。
sen.e: In the later middle ages, the political community formed by a league of ikki was armed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the later middle ages, the political community formed by a league of ikki would be armed.
In the later middle ages, the political community formed by a league of ikki would be armed.

sen.j: そのため、武装勢力の蜂起の意味合いを強く想起する向きもある。
sen.e: According to that fact, some people strongly associate ikki with an uprising of an armed group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Accordingly, some people strongly associate ikki with the uprising of an armed group.
Accordingly, some people strongly associate ikki with the uprising of an armed group.

sen.j: この時代、自検断権に基づいて、ほとんど全ての階層の共同体が軍事警察力と司法権の行使を認められていた。
sen.e: But it should be noted that, in this period, communities at almost all levels of the hierarchy were admitted to execute military and police powers and judicial power based on their right of jikendan (ruling and judging).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: One should note, however, that in this period communities at nearly all levels of the hierarchy were allowed to execute military and police powers and judicial power based on their right of jikendan (ruling and judging).

One should note, however, that in this period communities at nearly all levels of the hierarchy were allowed to execute military and police powers and judicial power based on their right of jikendan (ruling and judging).

sen.j: その達成のための保障となる武装は当然であったことを忘れてはならない。
sen.e: Thus, it was no surprising that they prepared arms to secure their achievement of the execution of the powers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it isn't surprising that they prepared arms in order to secure their execution of such powers.
Therefore, it isn't surprising that they prepared arms in order to secure their execution of such powers.

sen.j: 特に日本が明治期以降の近代に入り、江戸時代が最も近い前近代の「歴史」となってからは、一揆は「百姓一揆」を指すような印象がある。
sen.e: Especially after Japan entered the modern era after the Meiji period, and the Edo period became the latest "history" before the modern era, it is supposed that ikki somewhat began to mean "hyakusho ikki".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Significantly, after Japan entered the modern era following the Meiji period, and the Edo period became the latest "history" before the modern era, it is assumed that ikki began to mean "hyakusho ikki" to a certain extent.

Significantly, after Japan entered the modern era following the Meiji period, and the Edo period became the latest "history" before the modern era, it is assumed that ikki began to mean "hyakusho ikki" to a certain extent.

sen.j: 前述のように表向きは一揆の盟約が禁止されていながらも、百姓身分の権利行使の慣例として現実的には認めざるを得なかった。
sen.e: But in reality, even if ikki was ostensibly prohibited, they virtually had to admit ikki as a social custom to execute the right of those at the status of peasant as mentioned above.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In reality, even if ikki was ostensibly prohibited, they virtually had to admit ikki as a social custom by which to execute rights by people of peasant status, as mentioned above.
In reality, even if ikki was ostensibly prohibited, they virtually had to admit ikki as a social custom by which to execute rights by people of peasant status, as mentioned above.

sen.j: 現実と建前の著しく乖離した構図を持っていたこの時代の一揆をもって、日本の歴史的一揆の典型とみなすべきではないであろう。
sen.e: In this period, there was a discrepancy between the reality and the official prohibition regarding ikki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this period, there was a discrepancy between the reality and the official prohibition regarding ikki.

During this period, there was a discrepancy between the reality of the situation and the official prohibition regarding ikki; therefore, it is wrong to consider the types of ikki that were formed during this period to be typical of those that have been formed throughout Japanese history.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。内容もわかりやすく修正しています。

sen.j: この表向きの一揆の盟約の禁止下で行われた百姓一揆は、その建前上の性格ゆえに土寇（どこう）とも漢語表記された。
sen.e: Hyakusho ikki which took place under the ostensible prohibition on making a league of ikki was also written as the originally Chinese word 土寇 (doko) because of its official nature.
Hyakusho ikki, which took place under the ostensible prohibition of making a league of ikki, was, due to its official nature, also written as the originally Chinese word 土寇 (doko).
Hyakusho ikki, which took place under the ostensible prohibition of making a league of ikki, was, due to its official nature, also written as the originally Chinese word 土寇 (doko).

sen.j: 日本では、史学界で階級闘争史観が支配的だった時代がある。
sen.e: In the Japanese historical scientific world, a view of history of class struggle was once predominant.
In scientific field of Japanese historical research, a view based on the history of class struggle was once predominant.
In scientific field of Japanese historical research, a view based on the history of class struggle was once predominant.

sen.j: その時代には、「一揆は強者たる武士からの抑圧に対する、弱者たる民衆の決死の反抗であり、平等意識のもとで強固な団結力を持っていた」とみなす一揆観があった。
sen.e: A view of ikki in that period goes that ikki was a do-or-die rebellion among the commoners, the weak, against suppression by samurai warriors, the strong, and the ikki had strong solidarity under the consciousness of equality.

A view of ikki in that period asserts that ikki was a do-or-die rebellion among the commoners, or the weak, against suppression by samurai warriors (the strong), and the ikki had strong solidarity under the consciousness of equality.

A view of ikki in that period asserts that ikki was a do-or-die rebellion among the commoners, or the weak, against suppression by samurai warriors (the strong), and the ikki had strong solidarity under the consciousness of equality.

sen.j: この一揆観は、いまだに一般市民レベルでは普及している。
sen.e: That view of ikki is still accepted by citizen-level people.
That view of ikki is still accepted by the common citizenry.
That view of ikki is still accepted by the common citizenry.

sen.j: 上記のような事情を鑑みると、その一揆観は一揆のごく一部の相を見て創られたものに過ぎない。
sen.e: By considering the above-mentioned circumstances, however, that view of ikki seems to be formed on the basis of just an aspect of ikki.
Considering the above-mentioned circumstances, however, it appears that such a view of ikki is based on a particular aspect of ikki.
Considering the above-mentioned circumstances, however, it appears that such a view of ikki is based on a particular aspect of ikki.

sen.j: 実際の一揆は、大名層からの抑圧に関係なく結ばれることも多かった。
sen.e: Virtually, many ikki was frequently formed without regard of the presence of Daimyo level suppression.
Actually, ikki were frequently formed without regard for suppression by the rule of the daimyo.
Actually, ikki were frequently formed without regard for suppression by the rule of the daimyo.

sen.j: また、一揆内での主導権を巡る派閥抗争も絶えなかった。
sen.e: Besides, there was ceaseless factional infighting for leadership within ikki.
Additionally, there was ceaseless factional infighting for leadership within ikki.
Additionally, there was ceaseless factional infighting for leadership within ikki.

sen.j: こうした一揆内の派閥抗争を一揆内一揆と呼ぶことがある。
sen.e: That kind of factional infighting is sometimes called ikki within ikki.
That kind of factional infighting is sometimes called "ikki within ikki."
That kind of factional infighting is sometimes called "ikki within ikki."

sen.j: 越前一向一揆におけるものが有名である（下間頼照を参照）。
sen.e: A well-known ikki within ikki occurred in Echizen ikko ikki (religious riot) (see Raisho SHIMOTSUMA).
A well-known ikki within ikki occurred in the Echizen ikko ikki (religious riot) (see Raisho SHIMOTSUMA).
A well-known ikki within ikki occurred in the Echizen ikko ikki (religious riot) (see Raisho SHIMOTSUMA).

sen.j: 一揆の盟約を結ぶに際しては、神前で宣言内容や罰則などを記す起請文を書いて誓約を行い、紙を焼いた灰を飲む一味神水と呼ばれる儀式が行われた。
sen.e: A rite called Ichimi Shinsui (one taste of the gods' water) would be held to make a league of ikki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A rite called Ichimi Shinsui (one taste of the gods' water) would be held in order to establish a league of ikki.

To conclude an ikki, a rite called Ichimi Shinsui (one taste of the gods' water) would be held, during which the members would make a written and spoken vow, after which they would drink, before the gods, the ashes of the document in which they had written their declaration and the penalties to which they would be subject should they fail to honor the ikki.
sen.cmt: See above comment regarding "一揆の盟約".Also, I assume that "罰則" here means "the penalties to which they would be subject should they fail to honor the ikki". Please check if I am right in thinking this.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 室町時代から江戸初期までの社会用語としては、神社勢力が強訴などの要求を行うための武力である僧衆（江戸時代に僧兵と呼ばれる）も含め、中央もしくは地方政権から非公認の武装勢力そのものを指した。
sen.e: As social terminology from the Muromachi period to the Edo period, ikki referred to the military forces which had not been officially certified by the central government or the local government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As social terminology from the Muromachi period to the Edo period, ikki referred to the military forces that hadn't been officially certified by the central government or the local government.

As a sociological term from the Muromachi period to the Edo period, ikki referred to military forces that had not been officially recognized by the central government or the local government; such forces included monk-soldiers (known in Edo period as sohei, meaning "armed priests"), who the shrine authorities used to submit claims such as a goso (a petition lodged directly with the Imperial Court or the shogunate government).
sen.cmt: "shrine powers" is a bit unclear so I have changed it to "shrine leaders" on the basis that it would the leaders that hold the power. Please check if I have this right.

sen.j: もしくは、それらが何らかの主張のもと既成の支配体制に対して武力行使を含む抵抗運動を展開している状態を指した。
sen.e: Ikki also referred to a state of the uncertified military forces carrying out a resistance movement including the use of armed forces against the existing regime based on a claim.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ikki also referred to a state in which the uncertified military forces would carry out a resistance movement, including the use of armed forces, against the existing regime based on a claim.
Ikki also referred to a state in which the uncertified military forces would carry out a resistance movement, including the use of armed forces, against the existing regime based on a claim.

sen.j: 室町時代のそれを国一揆（くにいっき）と言う。
sen.e: Ikki in the Muromachi period is especially called kuni-ikki (uprising in a province).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Particularly, ikki of the Muromachi period is called kuni-ikki (provincial uprising).
Particularly, ikki of the Muromachi period is called kuni-ikki (provincial uprising).

sen.j: 通説的には惣領制が崩壊し、庶子家が独自の動きを取り始めると一族一揆を結ぶことで庶子家との繋がりを維持したが、やがて地縁による国人一揆へと発展したと言われる。
sen.e: When Soryo system (the eldest son system for the succession of the head of the family) was collapsed, the branch families began to act independently from the main line of the House.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When the Soryo system (the eldest-son system for succession as the head of the family) collapsed, the branch families began to act independently from the main line of the house.

It is commonly accepted that when the Soryo system (a system in which the eldest son would succeed as head of the family) collapsed, the branch families began to act independently from the main line of the house, which led to them maintaining relationships with other branch families by forming ichizoku ikki (family ikki) with them, and this is said to have developed into the forming of kokujin ikki based on territorial connections.
sen.cmt: 一文に戻しました。内容もわかりやすく修正しています。

sen.j: しかし、必ずしもそのように単純に移行した訳ではない。
sen.e: But in reality, ichizoku ikki was not so simply transferred into kokujin ikki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In reality, ichizoku ikki wasn't so easily transformed into kokujin ikki.
In reality, ichizoku ikki wasn't so easily transformed into kokujin ikki.

sen.j: 一般的には血統的正統性や圧倒的な武力を持つリーダーが存在しない場合が多かった。
sen.e: In general, ikki was neither based on lineage nor dominated by any leader who has overwhelming military forces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Generally, ikki was based neither on lineage nor dominated by a leader who had overwhelming military forces.
Generally, ikki was based neither on lineage nor dominated by a leader who had overwhelming military forces.

sen.j: そして、「連判状」はんせいに代表される一揆契状に見られるように、局地的には全参加者が平等で民主的な合議制の場合が多かった。
sen.e: In most cases, ikki locally had all the members treated equally in a democratic council system, as symbolized in ikki keijo (ikki deed) which is represented by "renpanjo" hansei.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「連判状」はんせいの意味が不明です。
sen.e: In most cases, ikki locally ensured equal treatment for all members within a democratic council system, as symbolized in ikki keijo (ikki deed) which is represented by the "renpanjo" hansei.
In most cases, ikki locally ensured equal treatment for all members within a democratic council system, as symbolized in ikki keijo (ikki deed) which is represented by the "renpanjo" hansei.

sen.j: それ故に迅速で統一的リーダーシップが存在しなかった。
sen.e: Therefore, ikki had no quick-responding ruling leadership.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, ikki had no quick-responding ruling leadership.
Therefore, ikki had no quick-responding ruling leadership.

sen.j: 大部分は一時強勢を誇っても内部分裂等で弱体化し、個別に撃破されるケースがほとんどであった。
sen.e: Even if ikki once boasted great power, most ikki was weakened by internal factionalization or the like, which caused most ikki to be individually defeated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even if ikki once boasted great power, most ikki were weakened by internal factionalization or the like, which caused most ikki to be defeated on an individual basis.
Even if ikki once boasted great power, most ikki were weakened by internal factionalization or the like, which caused most ikki to be defeated on an individual basis.

sen.j: しかし、中には守護など上位者が、地域の中小武士に斡旋して一揆を組織させる例も見られる。
sen.e: There were some cases in which a person in higher rank such as shugo (provincial constable) used its influence over small and middle class samurai in the area to organize ikki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There were cases in which a person of higher rank such as a shugo (provincial constable) used its influence over small and middle-class samurai in the area to organize ikki.
There were cases in which a person of higher rank such as a shugo (provincial constable) used its influence over small and middle-class samurai in the area to organize ikki.

sen.j: その場合、上位者は一揆を実質上の家臣団として編成した。
sen.e: Then the higher rank person virtually used that ikki as a group of his vassals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thus the higher rank person virtually could use that ikki as a group of vassals.
Thus the higher rank person virtually could use that ikki as a group of vassals.

sen.j: 南北朝時代から室町時代には、関東地方で武蔵七党など中小武士団による白旗一揆、武蔵平一揆などの国人一揆が盛んに結ばれる。
sen.e: From the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the Muromachi period, groups of small and middle class samurai such as Musashi-shichito Parties (seven parties of samurai in Musashi Province) had formed many kokujin ikki in the Kanto area.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the Muromachi period, groups of small and middle-class samurai such as Musashi-shichito parties (seven parties of samurai in Musashi Province) had formed many kokujin ikki in the Kanto area.

From the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the Muromachi period, groups of small and middle-class samurai such as Musashi-shichito parties (seven parties of samurai in Musashi Province) had formed many kokujin ikki in the Kanto area including shirahata ikki and musashi hei ikki.

sen.j: やがて同属集団である国人一揆から地域集団である国一揆へと主体が移り変わる。
sen.e: In due course, the main part of ikki gradually transferred from kokujin ikki which was a group of people of the same kind to kuni ikki which was a group of people in the same area.
Eventually, the main part of ikki was gradually transferred from kokujin ikki, which was a group of people of the same kind, to kuni ikki, which was a group of people in the same area.
Eventually, the main part of ikki was gradually transferred from kokujin ikki, which was a group of people of the same kind, to kuni ikki, which was a group of people in the same area.

sen.j: 国一揆は山城の国一揆、伊賀惣国一揆、甲賀郡中惣など畿内に集中する。
sen.e: Kuni ikki such as Yamashiro no Kuni ikki, Iga so koku ikki, and Koga gunchu so, appeared mostly in Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).
Kuni ikki such as Yamashiro no Kuni ikki, Iga so koku ikki and Koga gunchu so appeared mostly in the Kinai region (the provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).
Kuni ikki such as Yamashiro no Kuni ikki, Iga so koku ikki and Koga gunchu so appeared mostly in the Kinai region (the provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).

sen.j: 加賀国（石川県）では、室町時代に応仁の乱で東軍に属した守護の富樫氏を追放した。
sen.e: The biggest and only excellent example of ikki was in Kaga Province (Ishikawa Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The biggest and only excellent example of ikki was in Kaga Province (Ishikawa Prefecture).
In Kaga Province, the powers of ikki expelled the Togashi clan, which belonged to the Eastern Camp in the Onin War and had served as the shugo.
sen.cmt: 翻訳時の語順を変更しました。

sen.j: その後、戦国時代 (日本)まで百年近くに亘って一揆勢が共和国的な体制を維持していた最大にして唯一の成功例と言える。
sen.e: In Kaga Province, the powers of ikki expelled the Togashi clan which belonged to the Eastern Camp in the Onin War and had served as shugo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Kaga Province, the powers of ikki expelled the Togashi clan, which belonged to the Eastern Camp in the Onin War and had served as the shugo.
Thereafter, the powers maintained their republican regime over 100 years until the (Japanese) Sengoku period and this is the biggest and only excellent example of ikki.

sen.j: この場合も周辺諸国の事情がそれを許しただけにすぎない。
sen.e: In the Kaga case, however, merely the circumstances in neighboring provinces enabled the success.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in the Kaga case merely the circumstances in neighboring provinces facilitated the success.
However, in the Kaga case merely the circumstances in neighboring provinces facilitated the success.

sen.j: 現に事情が変われば瞬く間に内部分裂が起こり、織田信長と対立して敗北した。
sen.e: In fact, a change in the circumstances triggered internal dissension and the powers confronted Nobunaga ODA and defeated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In fact, a change in the circumstances triggered internal dissension, whereby the powers confronted Nobunaga ODA and defeated him.
sen.cmt: THIS IS TO SAY THAT ODA WAS DEFEATED. OTHERWISE, SAY but were defeated.
sen.e: In fact, a change in the circumstances triggered internal dissension, whereby the powers confronted Nobunaga ODA and they were defeated by him.

sen.j: 江戸時代には幕府が一揆を禁止した。
sen.e: In the Edo period, the shogunate government prohibited ikki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Edo period, the shogunate government prohibited ikki.
In the Edo period, the shogunate government prohibited ikki.

sen.j: 1637年の島原の乱以降は一揆は沈静化し、強訴や逃散など百姓一揆と呼ばれる闘争の形態が主流となる。
sen.e: After the Shimabara War in 1637, ikki uprisings had abated, and a form of struggle called hyakusho ikki including goso and chosan (farmer's desertion from his farm land as a resistance) began accounting for the largest proportion of ikki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ikki uprisings abated after the Shimabara War of 1637, and a form of struggle called hyakusho ikki, including goso and chosan (farmer's desertion from his land as a form of resistance), began to comprise the majority of ikki.

Ikki uprisings abated after the Shimabara War of 1637, and a form of struggle called hyakusho ikki, including goso and chosan (farmer's desertion from his land as a form of resistance), began to comprise the majority of ikki.

sen.j: 豊臣政権時代より領内の騒擾を理由とした大名改易のケースが現れた。
sen.e: From the time of the Toyotomi government, cases of daimyo kaieki (punishment on feudal lord by depriving of its territory) for a riot within the daimyo's territory began to be seen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From the time of the Toyotomi government, cases of daimyo kaieki (punishment of a feudal lordship by seizing its territory) for a riot within the daimyo's territory began to be seen.
From the time of the Toyotomi government, cases of daimyo kaieki (punishment of a feudal lordship by seizing its territory) for a riot within the daimyo's territory began to be seen.

sen.j: 「領内が治まっていない」ことを公然と示すことができれば、領主側に匹敵する武力を集めずとも、責任問題を恐れる領主や代官への重大な圧力となった。
sen.e: That means even commoners exerted great pressure on the daimyo (feudal lord) or daikan (local magistrate) by publicly showing that the territory is not properly administered, without preparing the military forces comparable to their lord.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, even commoners would exert great pressure on the daimyo (feudal lord) or daikan (local magistrate) by publicly showing that the territory wasn't properly administered, without preparing the military forces comparable to their lord.

Therefore, even commoners would exert great pressure on the daimyo (feudal lord) or daikan (local magistrate) by publicly showing that the territory wasn't properly administered, without preparing the military forces comparable to their lord because the lords were very afraid of having their responsibility questioned.

sen.j: 百姓一揆の闘争形態の分類として、代表越訴、惣百姓一揆、村方騒動、国訴などがあげられる。
sen.e: Form of struggle of hyakusho ikki can be classified into daihyo osso (illegal direct petition made by representative of village), so hyakusho ikki (political appeal made by the entire peasant in a village under the control of officials), murakata sodo (infighting developed into accusation), kokuso (or kuniso; legal petition made by peasants tied up across the border of province), and the like.

The form of struggle represented by hyakusho ikki can be classified into daihyo osso (illegal direct petition made by a representative of the village), so hyakusho ikki (political appeal made by all the peasants in a village under the control of officials), murakata sodo (infighting that develops into accusation), kokuso (or kuniso; a legal petition made by peasants tied up across the border of the province), etc.

The form of struggle represented by hyakusho ikki can be classified into daihyo osso (illegal direct petition made by a representative of the village), so hyakusho ikki (political appeal made by all the peasants in a village under the control of officials), murakata sodo (infighting that develops into accusation), kokuso (or kuniso; a legal petition made by peasants tied up across the border of the province), etc.

sen.j: 江戸時代後期の天明年間、天保年間には再び広域の一揆が多発する。
sen.e: In the Tenmei Era and the Tenpo Era in the late Edo period, many ikki began to occur again extensively.
In the Tenmei and Tenpo eras of the late Edo period, extensive ikki began to occur again.
In the Tenmei and Tenpo eras of the late Edo period, extensive ikki began to occur again.

sen.j: 幕末には世直し一揆が起こった。
sen.e: At the end of Edo period, yonaoshi ikki (peasant uprising to reform society) occurred.
At the end of the Edo period, yonaoshi ikki (peasant uprising to reform society) occurred.
At the end of the Edo period, yonaoshi ikki (peasant uprising to reform society) occurred.

sen.j: 明治には新政府の政策に反対する徴兵令反対一揆や解放令反対一揆、地租改正反対一揆が起こる。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, uprising for objecting policy of the new government including: choheirei hantai ikki (conscription ordinance objection uprising), kaihorei hantai ikki (edict of grand council of state objection uprising), and chiso kaisei hantai ikki (land-tax reform objection reform) occurred.

In the Meiji period, uprisings in objection to the policies of the new government, including choheirei hantai ikki (conscription ordinance objection uprising), kaihorei hantai ikki (edict of Grand Council of State objection uprising), and chiso kaisei hantai ikki (land-tax reform objection reform), occurred.

In the Meiji period, uprisings in objection to the policies of the new government, including choheirei hantai ikki (conscription ordinance objection uprising), kaihorei hantai ikki (edict of Grand Council of State objection uprising), and chiso kaisei hantai ikki (land-tax reform objection reform), occurred.
